page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: THE LAND IN THIS SQUARE IS DIVIDED BETWEEN THE PARISHES OF STOKE GOLDINGTON, RAVENSTONE, GAYHURST, FILGRAVE CUM TYRINGHAM,LATHBURY AND A MINUTE PART OF EMBERTON.THE WHOLE AREA IS DEVOTED TO AGRICULTURE AND IS NOT DENSELY POPULATED. THE MAIN CENTRES OF POPULATION ARE THE VILLAGES OF GAYHURST AND FILGRAVE WITH OTHERS HOUSES AND FARM WIDELY SCATTERED OVER THE WHOLE AREA. THE RIVER GREAT OUSE FLOWS THROUGH NEARLY ALL OF THE 12 KILOMETER SQUARES AND ITS PROPENSITY TO FLOOD THE SURROUNDING FIELDS HAS A NOTICEABALE IMPACT ON FARMING.POPULATION HAS GROWN IN RECENT YEARS, THOUGH NOT SUBSTANTIALLY, BUT AS A COMMUNITY IT IS SUFFERING FROM PROBLEMS COMMON TO MANY OTHER RURAL COMMUNITIES IN BRITAIN e.g. CLOSURE OF THE LOCAL VILLAGE SCHOOL, POST OFFICE AND EVEN PARISH CHURCH.
